div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 462px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 700px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

p.font:
You are an ordinary Greek person from a relatively large town, with no
special education or academic skills.
You will be given a list of Greek proverbs.
Assign each to a category such as "love", "money", "warning against", "work" etc according to its meaning. The number of categories must be smaller than 10.

Input:
5. "Έργατα και δουλείας"
6. "Σαν θέλ' η νύφ' κι η γαμπρός μπομπή κ' τα συμπεθέρια"
7. "Ο πετεινόν που κουγίζει παρώρας, κόφτει το κεφάλιν ατ"
Output:
5. Work
6. Marriage
7. Warning

Make sure to use general categories. For example instead of:
1. "Κάλλιο γαιδουρόδερνε, παρά γαιδουρογύρευε" // Hard Work
2. "Η δουλειά δέ χρίζει μούτρα" // Work Ethics
3. "Έργατα και δουλείας" // Working
Write:
1. Work
2. Work
3. Work

Input:
1 Όποιος δεν τον ξέρ΄ ακριβά τον αγοράζει
2 Τα 'θελες και τα 'παθες
3 Αδειανός μασκαράς, παραχέρ 'τ' χουριού
